raw.title: [BIP-699] Enable a wstETH/GYD gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1358

**Summary**
> This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge on Arbitrum for a wstETH/GYD E-CLP. 

**References/Useful links**

> Links
> * [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

**Protocol Description**

>* GYD is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/).
>* wstETH is a static wrapper of stETH. stETH is a yield bearing token that represents staked ether in [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5230610-what-is-steth).


**Motivation**

> Gyroscope is launching further strategic pools. The calibration was improved over the previously deployed, equivalent pool that was whitelisted [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-691-enable-gauge-for-gyd-wsteth-e-clp-arbitrum/5956).

**Specification**
 
>1. **Governance:** The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
>
>
>2. **Oracles:** 
> * ‘rateProvider0’: wstETH rate provider on Arbitrum: [0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836)
and relevant [review ](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/wstethRateProvider.md).
> *  ‘rateProvider1’: GYD rate provider on Arbitrum: [0x72F6Da3b4bd0Ab7028F52339Ee3B1f94fffe2dD0](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x72F6Da3b4bd0Ab7028F52339Ee3B1f94fffe2dD0).
>
>3. **Audits:** Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** n/a.
>
>6. **Value:** This pool is intended to be the primary source of liquidity for the token(s). 

#### Contracts

> * E-CLP: [0x6ce1D1e46548ef657f8D7Ebddfc4BEaDB04F72f3](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x6ce1D1e46548ef657f8D7Ebddfc4BEaDB04F72f3)
>* Child gauge on Arbitrum: [0x654a17A779B82BA7739cD3Adb2052e039c4366C5](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x654a17A779B82BA7739cD3Adb2052e039c4366C5)
>* Arbitrum root gauge on Ethereum: [0x9E965252d1b294aF358a232933A65Bd30645c34C](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9E965252d1b294aF358a232933A65Bd30645c34C)

#### Specification


>Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
>gauge(address): `0x9E965252d1b294aF358a232933A65Bd30645c34C`
>gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-494] Enable FRAX/sfrxETH gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/665

**Summary:**
> We request adding FRAX/sfrxETH 50/50 weighted pool on optimism to BAL gauge 

**References/Useful links:**
> Link to
    • [Website](https://frax.finance/)
    • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)
    • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)

**Protocol Description:**

> Frax is a stable coin issued by Frax and sfrxETH is a Frax’s staked wrapped ETH token

**Motivation:**

> As a joint effort with FRAX and Beethoven X, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for frax assets on optimism. The BAL gauge will facilitate the process. 

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505), the pool does not rely on additional oracles. 
3. **Audits:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
4. **Centralization vectors:** see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview). 
5. **Market History:** See [FRAX](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/frax) and [sfrxETH](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sfrxETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0x478980c67d53cd990f2b7bab311ddc9934324e7b00020000000000000000010c
Link to child gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x317e0451Da949Ee999aAc2d7Bc063737f5Fe84e5
Link to root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x057e7b14DC461f071958e0BbF42b5597564D4e6C#code

**Specification**:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x057e7b14DC461f071958e0BbF42b5597564D4e6C`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-495] Enable frxETH/sfrxETH metastable pool gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/666

**Summary:**

> We request adding frxETH/sfrxETH metastable pool on optimism to BAL gauge

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to
> • [Website](https://frax.finance/)
> • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)
> • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)

**Protocol Description:**

> frxETH is Frax's wrapped ETH token and sfrxETH is its staked interest bearing version

**Motivation:**

> As a joint effort with FRAX and Beethoven X, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for frax assets on optimism. The BAL gauge will facilitate the process.

**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505), the pool does not rely on additional oracles.
3. **Audits:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
4. **Centralization vectors:** see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview).
5. **Market History:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sfrxETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0xa71021492a3966eec735ed1b505afa097c7cfe6f00000000000000000000010d
Link to child gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xc46AB6Aa92F7c30B8Fb1D445b4B957203EbBbd6e
Root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x5622821A3b993f062Ff691478Bbb7d551c167321#code

**Specification**:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x5622821A3b993f062Ff691478Bbb7d551c167321`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-700] Enable a wstETH/GYD gauge [Ethereum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1359

**Summary**
> This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge on Ethereum for a wstETH/GYD E-CLP. 

**References/Useful links**

> Links
> * [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

**Protocol Description**

>* GYD is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/).
>* wstETH is a static wrapper of stETH. stETH is a yield bearing token that represents staked ether in [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5230610-what-is-steth).


**Motivation**

> Gyroscope is launching further strategic pools.

**Specification**
 
>1. **Governance:** The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
>
>
>2. **Oracles:** 
> * ‘rateProvider0’: wstETH rate provider on Ethereum: [0x72D07D7DcA67b8A406aD1Ec34ce969c90bFEE768](https://etherscan.io/address/0x72D07D7DcA67b8A406aD1Ec34ce969c90bFEE768)
and relevant [review ](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/wstethRateProvider.md).
> *  ‘rateProvider1’: GYD rate provider on Ethereum: [0xD43F5a722e8e7355D790adda4642f392Dfb820a1](https://etherscan.io/address/0xD43F5a722e8e7355D790adda4642f392Dfb820a1).
>
>3. **Audits:** Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** This is the first wstETH/GYD E-CLP on Ethereum.
>
>6. **Value:** This pool is intended to be the primary source of liquidity for the token(s). 

#### Contracts

> * E-CLP: [0xC8cF54b0b70899Ea846B70361e62F3F5B22b1f4B](https://etherscan.io/address/0xC8cF54b0b70899Ea846B70361e62F3F5B22b1f4B)
>* Gauge: [0xCda69C40176B98bB1773109d1fEa91e12F478451](https://etherscan.io/address/0xCda69C40176B98bB1773109d1fEa91e12F478451)


#### Specification


>Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
>gauge(address): `0xCda69C40176B98bB1773109d1fEa91e12F478451`
>gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-723] Enable two E-CLP gauges [Gnosis]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1437

**Summary**
> This is a proposal to enable two uncapped Balancer gauges on Gnosis Chain for (1) a GYD/aUSDC.e Rehype Pool and (2) a GYD/sDAI E-CLP.

**References/Useful links**

> Links
> * [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

**Protocol Description**

>* GYD is a USD denominated meta-stablecoin, issued by [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/).
>* USDC.e is the bridged version of a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [Circle](https://www.circle.com/en/usdc). aUSDC.e is the yield-bearing deposit receipt token for lending out USDC.e on Aave, in a static wrapper. 
> * sDAI is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [MakerDAO](https://makerdao.com/en/), staked to earn yield.


**Motivation**

> GYD is launching on Gnosis Chain. These are two core pools to enable initial liquidity.

**Specification**
 
>1. **Governance:** The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
>
>
>2. **Oracles:** 
> * GYD/aUSDC.e
>   * ‘rateProvider0’: 0x00
>   *  ‘rateProvider1’: [0x5F62fd24941B585b91EB059E0ea1a7e729357511](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x5F62fd24941B585b91EB059E0ea1a7e729357511) (and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/statATokenLMRateProvider.md))
> * GYD/sDAI
>   * ‘rateProvider0’: [0x89C80A4540A00b5270347E02e2E144c71da2EceD](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x89C80A4540A00b5270347E02e2E144c71da2EceD) (and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/SavingsDAIRateProviderGnosis.md))
>   *  ‘rateProvider1’: 0x00
>
>3. **Audits:** Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** These are the first GYD pools on Gnosis Chain.
>
>6. **Value:** This pool is intended to better match the historic prices and low volatility of the included tokens. 

#### Contracts

> * GYD/aUSDC.e 
>   * E-CLP: [0x263A6Edafa6444DC2ae550f9EFF6344c1686d6aA](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x263A6Edafa6444DC2ae550f9EFF6344c1686d6aA)
>   * Child Gauge: [0xeCC38A7E4EB20FB72BA1cDcF2fC7A6002C6C59f3](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xeCC38A7E4EB20FB72BA1cDcF2fC7A6002C6C59f3)
>   * Root Gauge: [0xFa2F6BE7cF4da6FaE6A011A4EFC53180c9Cf0a1b](https://etherscan.io/address/0xFa2F6BE7cF4da6FaE6A011A4EFC53180c9Cf0a1b)
>
> * GYD/sDAI 
>   * E-CLP: [0x1e8b447129984d8A6B652C807DfC3bd135973133](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x1e8b447129984d8A6B652C807DfC3bd135973133)
>   * Child Gauge: [0xEA71b7FDAA3683D2d307e8AF3e236FB7a395e88d](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xEA71b7FDAA3683D2d307e8AF3e236FB7a395e88d)
>   * Root Gauge: [0xe2251F5cc98f8Ccd8812Be9c0aAe8A9bD29500F3](https://etherscan.io/address/0xe2251F5cc98f8Ccd8812Be9c0aAe8A9bD29500F3)


#### Specification


>Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function twice with the following arguments:
>
>gauge(address): `0xFa2F6BE7cF4da6FaE6A011A4EFC53180c9Cf0a1b`
>gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`
>
>gauge(address): `0xe2251F5cc98f8Ccd8812Be9c0aAe8A9bD29500F3`
>gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: Proposal to enable Balancer gauges on Arbitrum for USDX/USDT and sUSDX/USDX pools, aiming to bootstrap liquidity and support the stablecoin infrastructure project usdx.money.
key_arguments_for: Strong timeline voting lead and stability for the 'Yes, let's do it' option with high voting power.
Positive market impact with price increase of 4.19% and TVL increase of 6.93% during the event window.
Adjacent similar proposals with similar changes mostly resulted in positive outcomes and successful votes.
Proposal supports onboarding more users and increasing liquidity for USDX and sUSDX on Arbitrum, enhancing ecosystem growth.
key_arguments_against: One negative forum comment expressing concerns, but overall forum sentiment is mostly neutral.
Centralization vectors exist due to multisig ownership of contracts, which may concern some voters.

evidence.quote: 3 comments: 1 Negative, 2 Neutral; first comment detailed the proposal and showed some concerns; second comment requested vote; third comment linked to snapshot.
Timeline metrics show 100% lead ratio and stability for 'Yes, let's do it' option with majority voting power.
Similar proposals BIP-744 and BIP-743 had successful 'Yes' outcomes; price and TVL impact mostly positive or neutral.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Voting timeline shows a stable and decisive lead for 'Yes, let's do it', indicating strong voter confidence.
- Market data during the event window reflects positive price and TVL movement, supporting the potential success of enabling these gauges.
- Similar past proposals with enabling gauges showed positive or neutral market outcomes, reinforcing the change stance.
- Forum sentiment is mostly neutral to slightly negative but does not oppose the proposal strongly; the recommendation aligns well with community voting patterns and supports long-term ecosystem growth.
